Package control

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
control.Controller
control.Menu
public class Menu
extends Controller
The Menu class controls the main menu bar of the application and handles loading different scenes into the content pane underneath the menubar.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class control.Controller

    APPOINTMENT_FORM_FXML, CUSTOMER_FORM_FXML, CUSTOMERS_FXML, dao, LOGIN_FXML, MENU_FXML, REPORT_FXML, SCHEDULE_FXML, TIME_FORMAT

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Menu()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Opens the AppointmentForm in a new window, when the form is closed it reloads the scene in the content pane.
    void addCustomer​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Opens the CustomerForm in a new window, when the form is closed it reloads the scene in the content pane.
    void appointmentView​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Handles loading the schedule scene into content when Appointments is selected from the View menu.
    void contactSchedule​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Opens a new window with the report of each contact's schedule.
    void customerSchedule​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Opens a new window with the report of each customer's schedule.
    void customerView​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Handles loading the customers scene into content when Customers is selected from the View menu.
    void delete​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Calls the delete method of the controller for the scene in the content pane.
    void exit​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Exits the application.
    void initialize()
    The initialize method sets the content pane to the schedule initially.
    void modify​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Calls the modify method of the controller for the scene in the content pane.
    void typeMonthReport​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Opens a new window with the report of appointments by month and type.

      public void customerView​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws java.io.IOException

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the fxml path is not valid.
